intro: Bupleurum aequiradiatum, commonly known as the Indian skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayas and parts of South Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties. Bupleurum aequiradiatum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas at higher elevations.
